ovdesc.p: This table defines the various line structures that are available for use within MI databases. For example a typical line structure might be Summary customer profitability report.

desc.p: Used to specify that each transaction or account should appear only once in this report.

Input of No will cause the system to allocate accounts and contracts to each line where they match the selection criteria. It is strongly recommended that this option is used with caution because of the difficulty of managing such precise MI.LINE selections and for performance reasons.
The identity code of the line structure.

This field may be up to 10 characters long, however a maximum of four characters is recommended because the value is used extensively throughout the MI application and rekeying a long definition may prove tedious.
Description of a group of lines.
Part of a multi-value set with GROUP.LINE.FROM and GROUP.LINE.TO.
The line number of the lower end of a reporting group.
This field forms part of a multi-value set with GROUP.LINE.TO and GROUP.DESC.
These fields are used to divide the report lines into groups for reporting purposes.

For example of lines 1 to 0999 are for Assets and 1000 to 1999 are for liabilities then this definition can be specified here in two multi-value sets. MI will automatically add the description of the group (in field GROUP.DESC) to each MI.LINE record. This can subsequently be referenced in enquiries and reports and used to break up the final MI output into reporting ranges.
Ranges must be input in ascencing sequence.
Must be numeric and less than 9999
Must be greater than any earlier group. (i.e. line groups must be input in ascending sequence.
Forms part of a multi-value set with GROUP.LINE.FROM and GROUP.DESC.
Must be numeric and less than 10000
Must be greater than the GROUP.LINE.FROM for this multi-value set.
